Regardless of the fact there are alternative views out there that are trying to engage in revisionist Biblical interpretation about homosexual behavior because it's more PC to do it that way, the main accepted interpretation by most Biblical scholars is that the Bible does consider it a sin. And it has been the scholarly agreed-upon interpretation for 2 millenia. It's the most ridiulous uphill battle to try and make the Bible say something different that it so clearly says. Essentially the people who claim this fall back on the typical revisionist tactics of claiming it's all a matter of "translation errors" or saying the Hebrew or Greek can be read more than one way (ignoring the fact that the context clearly supports the mainline interpretation). This sort of hermeneutical gymnastics is the equivilent of taking a coat hanger and insisting it's not a coat hanger but really a tv antenna, and when told it's not, twisting the coat hanger up into the rough shape of a tv antenna and saying "see, I told you so--it's a tv antenna!" Sure, it can be reshaped into that, but it's still really a coat hanger. Frankly, it would make a lot more sense for these revisionists to simply disagree with the Bible rather than try and convince all of Christendom that it doesn't say what it clearly says. That tactic simply is never going to work.
